channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16486] Unify system table creation using the same createSystemTable API.
item.description: All other system tables (namespace, quota, rsgroups) calls CreateTableProcedure directly; only ACL and labels system tables calls HMaster.createTable(), which will go through preCreateTable and postCreateTable Coprocessor. This is unnecessary and we should make the ACL system table creation the same as other system tables.
item.summary: Unify system table creation using the same createSystemTable API.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

This message was automatically generated.

From offline discussion with Matteo Bertozzi: "I was talked a bit with stack about this to get his opinion.
aside from the fact that the one liner master.createTable() looks better than the two lines to create the regions and call new CreateTableProcedure().
HMaster should be the non RPC way to do stuff.. so master.createTable() should be a "good" way to call tables.. but there are a bunch of problems like the checkInitialized() that we don't want to wait on especially for sys tables. so one option is to create a master.createSysTable()..."

Based on this feedback, I unified all system table creation under a new master.createSystemTable() API in the attach V3 patch.

one open question that I had, but I think is more for people writing their own coprocessors, is can we skip pre/post create for system tables. or people writing coprocessor may want to be notified about all the table being added to the system? e.g. some table tracking coproc or similar
My thoughts is that system tables are special tables to support functionality of hbase cluster. I don't see the tracking of system table creation would do any good/bad to coprocessor.

+1 overall

From Matteo Bertozzi: "you already got +1 from ashish and anoop. you can just commit, i'm ok with the patch even if i'm still not convinced about bypassing the coproc for sys table. but i have no use case that i know of."
